description: After hours of deliberation, Oksana Lintz decides the public must know the full truth. She prepares BCI audit logs and Halden’s coded diary entries for broad release, confiding her intentions to only one trusted colleague.

Anonymous caches of BCI audit logs and excerpts from Halden’s diary appear throughout Stenograd, exposing evidence of forced disappearances and past abuses. The documents ignite widespread outrage, with residents demanding answers at impromptu town meetings.
Former BCI records of vanished citizens appear as deactivated 'ghost profiles' in public view. Truth commissions begin to form in several districts, pressuring Council factions for accountability.
Families of the disappeared lead mass protests at Council buildings. Council officials are forced into public hearings, where citizens question the legitimacy of BCI and demand justice.

With unrest and civic debate intensifying, the Council announces a citywide referendum: citizens must vote to either abolish the BCI entirely or reset it with permanent public oversight. The outcome will fundamentally reshape Stenograd’s system of governance.
